trans-unit.source: Using Remote Desktop with Azure Roles
trans-unit.target: Using Remote Desktop with Azure Roles

trans-unit.source: Using Remote Desktop with Azure Roles
trans-unit.target: Using Remote Desktop with Azure Roles

trans-unit.source: Using Remote Desktop with Azure Roles
trans-unit.target: Using Remote Desktop with Azure Roles

trans-unit.source: By using the Azure SDK and Remote Desktop Services, you can access Azure roles and virtual machines that are hosted by Azure.
trans-unit.target: By using the Azure SDK and Remote Desktop Services, you can access Azure roles and virtual machines that are hosted by Azure.

trans-unit.source: In Visual Studio, you can configure Remote Desktop Services from an Azure project.
trans-unit.target: In Visual Studio, you can configure Remote Desktop Services from an Azure project.

trans-unit.source: To enable Remote Desktop Services, you must create a working project that contains one or more roles and then publish it to Azure.
trans-unit.target: To enable Remote Desktop Services, you must create a working project that contains one or more roles and then publish it to Azure.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.IMPORTANT] You should access an Azure role for troubleshooting or development only.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.IMPORTANT] You should access an Azure role for troubleshooting or development only.

trans-unit.source: The purpose of each virtual machine is to run a specific role in your Azure application, not to run other client applications.
trans-unit.target: The purpose of each virtual machine is to run a specific role in your Azure application, not to run other client applications.

trans-unit.source: If you want to use Azure to host a virtual machine that you can use for any purpose, see Accessing Azure Virtual Machines from Server Explorer.
trans-unit.target: If you want to use Azure to host a virtual machine that you can use for any purpose, see Accessing Azure Virtual Machines from Server Explorer.

trans-unit.source: To enable and use Remote Desktop for an Azure Role
trans-unit.target: To enable and use Remote Desktop for an Azure Role

trans-unit.source: In Solution Explorer, open the shortcut menu for your project, and then choose **Publish**.
trans-unit.target: In Solution Explorer, open the shortcut menu for your project, and then choose **Publish**.

trans-unit.source: The **Publish Azure Application** wizard appears.
trans-unit.target: The **Publish Azure Application** wizard appears.

trans-unit.source: Publish command for a Cloud Service project
trans-unit.target: Publish command for a Cloud Service project

trans-unit.source: At the bottom of **Microsoft Azure Publish Settings** page of the wizard, select the **Enable Remote Desktop** for all roles check box.
trans-unit.target: At the bottom of **Microsoft Azure Publish Settings** page of the wizard, select the **Enable Remote Desktop** for all roles check box.

trans-unit.source: The **Remote Desktop Configuration** dialog box appears.
trans-unit.target: The **Remote Desktop Configuration** dialog box appears.

trans-unit.source: At the bottom of the **Remote Desktop Configuration** dialog box, choose the **More Options** button.
trans-unit.target: At the bottom of the **Remote Desktop Configuration** dialog box, choose the **More Options** button.

trans-unit.source: This displays a dropdown list box that lets you create or choose a certificate so that you can encrypt credentials information when connecting via remote desktop.
trans-unit.target: This displays a dropdown list box that lets you create or choose a certificate so that you can encrypt credentials information when connecting via remote desktop.

trans-unit.source: In the dropdown list, choose **<Create>**, or choose an existing one from the list.
trans-unit.target: In the dropdown list, choose **<Create>**, or choose an existing one from the list.

trans-unit.source: If you choose an existing certificate, skip the following steps.
trans-unit.target: If you choose an existing certificate, skip the following steps.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] The certificates that you need for a remote desktop connection are different from the certificates that you use for other Azure operations.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] The certificates that you need for a remote desktop connection are different from the certificates that you use for other Azure operations.

trans-unit.source: The remote access certificate must have a private key.
trans-unit.target: The remote access certificate must have a private key.

trans-unit.source: The **Create Certificate** dialog box appears.
trans-unit.target: The **Create Certificate** dialog box appears.

trans-unit.source: Provide a friendly name for the new certificate, and then choose the **OK** button.
trans-unit.target: Provide a friendly name for the new certificate, and then choose the **OK** button.

trans-unit.source: The new certificate appears in the dropdown list box.
trans-unit.target: The new certificate appears in the dropdown list box.

trans-unit.source: In the **Remote Desktop Configuration** dialog box, provide a user name and a password.
trans-unit.target: In the **Remote Desktop Configuration** dialog box, provide a user name and a password.

trans-unit.source: You can’t use an existing account.
trans-unit.target: You can’t use an existing account.

trans-unit.source: Don’t specify Administrator as the user name for the new account.
trans-unit.target: Don’t specify Administrator as the user name for the new account.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] If the password doesn’t meet the complexity requirements, a red icon appears next to the password text box.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] If the password doesn’t meet the complexity requirements, a red icon appears next to the password text box.

trans-unit.source: The password must include capital letters, lowercase letters, and numbers or symbols.
trans-unit.target: The password must include capital letters, lowercase letters, and numbers or symbols.

trans-unit.source: Choose a date on which the account will expire and after which remote desktop connections will be blocked.
trans-unit.target: Choose a date on which the account will expire and after which remote desktop connections will be blocked.

trans-unit.source: After you've provided all the required information, choose the **OK** button.
trans-unit.target: After you've provided all the required information, choose the **OK** button.

trans-unit.source: Several settings that enable Remote Access Services are added to the .cscfg and .csdef files.
trans-unit.target: Several settings that enable Remote Access Services are added to the .cscfg and .csdef files.

trans-unit.source: In the **Microsoft Azure Publish Settings** wizard, choose the **OK** button when you’re ready to publish your cloud service.
trans-unit.target: In the **Microsoft Azure Publish Settings** wizard, choose the **OK** button when you’re ready to publish your cloud service.

trans-unit.source: If you're not ready to publish, choose the **Cancel** button.
trans-unit.target: If you're not ready to publish, choose the **Cancel** button.

trans-unit.source: The configuration settings are saved, and you can publish your cloud service later.
trans-unit.target: The configuration settings are saved, and you can publish your cloud service later.

trans-unit.source: Connect to an Azure Role by using Remote Desktop
trans-unit.target: Connect to an Azure Role by using Remote Desktop

trans-unit.source: After you publish your cloud service on Azure, you can use Server Explorer to log into the virtual machines that Azure hosts.
trans-unit.target: After you publish your cloud service on Azure, you can use Server Explorer to log into the virtual machines that Azure hosts.

trans-unit.source: In Server Explorer, expand the **Azure** node, and then expand the node for a cloud service and one of its roles to display a list of instances.
trans-unit.target: In Server Explorer, expand the **Azure** node, and then expand the node for a cloud service and one of its roles to display a list of instances.

trans-unit.source: Open the shortcut menu for an instance node, and then choose **Connect Using Remote Desktop**.
trans-unit.target: Open the shortcut menu for an instance node, and then choose **Connect Using Remote Desktop**.

trans-unit.source: Connecting via remote desktop
trans-unit.target: Connecting via remote desktop

trans-unit.source: Enter the user name and password that you created previously.
trans-unit.target: Enter the user name and password that you created previously.

trans-unit.source: You are now logged into your remote session.
trans-unit.target: You are now logged into your remote session.

trans-unit.source: test
trans-unit.target: test
